title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 §§ 8200-2.2 - Failure to file
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 §§ 8200-2.2 - Failure to file

State Regulations
(a) Whenever it
shall appear that a railroad owner has failed to file a report or reports in a
prescribed format as determined by ORPTS as of the date required by this

Subpart, an adjudicatory proceeding concerning the alleged failure will be held
in the manner provided in Part 8187 of this Title. (b) If it is determined, pursuant to such
adjudicatory proceeding, that the railroad owner has failed to file a report or
reports in the time and manner provided in this Subpart, the following
penalties will be imposed upon the railroad owner: (1)
a penalty of $100 for each failure; and
(2)
an additional fine of $50
per day for each day the failure continues, beginning with the day on which the
failure first occurred. Notes
